meanings.definition: To restore to a good state of repair.
meanings.sent1: The old house was renovated with fresh paint and new windows.
meanings.sent2: The school renovated the playground to make it safe for the children.
meanings.sent3: After the renovation, the house looked so much better!
meanings.sent4: Her smile renovated the gloomy atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The renovation transformed the worn-out building into a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To make new or as if new again.
meanings.sent1: The artist renovated the painting by adding vibrant colors.
meanings.sent2: The company renovated its logo to attract younger customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to renovate the torn paper back into one piece.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude renovated my outlook on life.
meanings.sent5: The rain renovated the dry, cracked earth into fertile soil.

meanings.sent1: A good night's sleep can renovate your energy levels.
meanings.sent2: The vacation renovated their relationship and brought them closer.
meanings.sent3: The cup of coffee renovated his focus during the long meeting.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter renovated the dull party into a lively gathering.
meanings.sent5: The music renovated my spirit and lifted my mood.
